title: Quiz 6: Preparedness & Risk Reduction
description: Test your knowledge on Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR), Emergency Operation Plans (EOP), and preparedness measures.

questions.question: Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) forms the pillar of disaster ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: DRR forms the pillar of disaster preparedness.

questions.question: Which of the following are included in Preparedness measures? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Plans, training, warning systems, and inventories are preparedness. Search and rescue is Response.
questions.hint: Select items done BEFORE the disaster.

questions.question: Match the DRR measure to its example:
questions.explanation: Sea-walls=Physical; Institutional strengthening=Capacity building; Diversifying crops=Agriculture.
questions.hint: Match the activity to the category.

questions.question: Which section of the Emergency Operation Plan (EOP) describes the roles and relationships of government agencies and the private sector?
questions.explanation: Concept of Operations describes roles, relationships, and interactions between agencies.

questions.question: Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) focuses only on actions taken AFTER a disaster has occurred.
questions.explanation: DRR involves action plans implemented BEFORE, during, and after disasters to reduce risks.

questions.question: What is the goal of emergency preparedness programmes?

options.text: To achieve a satisfactory level of readiness to respond to emergencies
To rely solely on international aid

questions.explanation: The goal is readiness to respond effectively.

questions.question: What document sets out the scope of activities required for community preparedness and response at the national level?
questions.explanation: The Emergency Operation Plan (EOP) sets out the scope of activities.

questions.question: Rank the structure of the EOP sections in the order they typically appear:
questions.explanation: Standard EOP structure starts with Purpose, then Situation, then Responsibilities, then Concept.

questions.question: Why is mainstreaming gender in emergency planning important? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Women are often not well-represented in decision making
Involving women broadens the range of ideas
It results in plans that are more disaster-resilient
It is required to reduce the budget

questions.explanation: Involving women improves plan resilience and representation; it is not about budget reduction.

questions.question: Children should not be involved in disaster design strategies as they lack capacity.
questions.explanation: Offering children opportunities to participate strengthens their capacity and contributes to democratization.
